introPage.title: Mindfulness & Stress: A Reflective Quiz
introPage.introduction:
💡 This isn’t a test, it's just a chance to reflect on how stress shows up in your life and how mindfulness might help.

There are no right or wrong answers, just an opportunity to notice patterns and explore new perspectives. Press start when you're ready to begin.

answers.text: Struggling to focus when studying
Feeling overwhelmed by deadlines
Overthinking past conversations or future events
Finding it hard to switch off and relax
Balancing university, work, and personal life

params.question: University can be stressful in different ways. Which of these do you relate to the most? (Choose one or more)

answers.text: Power through, even if you feel exhausted
Avoid the work and distract yourself with something else
Overthink every possible outcome and feel stuck
Take a short break, breathe, and then return to it

params.question: When you’re feeling stressed about university work, what do you usually do?

answers.text: You check obsessively for updates, feeling more anxious each time
You distract yourself, but the worry still lingers in the background
You tell yourself you’re overreacting, but the thoughts don’t go away
You acknowledge your nerves and bring your focus back to what you’re doing

params.question: Imagine you’re waiting for an important grade or email response. Your mind keeps jumping to worst-case scenarios. What tends to happen?

answers.text: Tense shoulders, clenched jaw, or headaches
Feeling restless or unable to sit still
Tired all the time, even after sleeping
Upset stomach or digestion issues
Racing heart or shallow breathing

params.question: Stress can show up in the body, sometimes in ways we don’t expect. Which of these have you noticed in yourself?

answers.text: Going for a walk or moving your body
Taking deep breaths or focusing on something in the present moment
Talking to a friend or writing things down
Doing something creative or calming (music, art, journaling)
Nothing really works, I just try to wait it out

params.question: When you feel overwhelmed, what helps you feel more grounded?

answers.text: Feeling calmer in stressful situations
Focusing better when studying
Letting go of overthinking or self-criticism
Enjoying downtime without feeling guilty
Sleeping better or feeling more rested

params.question: If mindfulness could help with just one thing in your life right now, what would it be?

endGame.noResultMessage: This week, you’ll explore mindfulness techniques that can help with these common challenges.
